task.name: Import_from_Cassandra
task.description: This task allows importing data from Cassandra. The task requires the following third-party credentials: CASSANDRA_USERNAME and CASSANDRA_PASSWORD. Please refer to the User documentation to learn how to add third-party credentials. It requires the following variables: $CASSANDRA_DATABASE: the database to use. It is created if it does not exist $CASSANDRA_COLLECTION: the collection to use. It is created if it does not exist $CASSANDRA_OUPUT: The name of the output csv file. The imported data is also exported in a JSON format using the variable $DATAFRAME_JSON.

task.name: Export_to_Cassandra
task.description: This task allows exporting data to Cassandra. The task requires the following third-party credentials: CASSANDRA_USERNAME and CASSANDRA_PASSWORD. Please refer to the User documentation to learn how to add third-party credentials. It requires the following variables: $CASSANDRA_TABLE (required) Data is stored in tables containing rows of columns, similar to SQL definitions.. It is created if it does not exist $CASSANDRA_KEY (required) A primary key identifies the location and order of stored data. The primary key is defined when the table is created and cannot be altered. $CASSANDRA_INPUT (required) A csv file to be inserted in Cassandra. This variable can: - An URL. Valid URL schemes include http, ftp, s3, and file. - A relative path in the data space of a csv file.
